headline: Petroperu accelerates talks for Amazon oil block partner
summary: LIMA (Reuters) -Peru's state-run oil company Petroperu is in talks with five firms, including Canada's PetroTal and U.S.-based Upland Oil and Gas, as it seeks a partner to reactivate a key Amazon oil block, a company executive said late Thursday.  Tomas Diaz, manager of Petroperu's exploration and exploitation unit, told Reuters the company expects to reach an agreement for Lot 192 by mid-to-late July.  The reactivation of Lot 192, located near the border with Ecuador, is crucial for supplying Petroperu's newly modernized Talara refinery.

raw.headline: Petroperu accelerates talks for Amazon oil block partner
raw.summary: LIMA (Reuters) -Peru's state-run oil company Petroperu is in talks with five firms, including Canada's PetroTal and U.S.-based Upland Oil and Gas, as it seeks a partner to reactivate a key Amazon oil block, a company executive said late Thursday.  Tomas Diaz, manager of Petroperu's exploration and exploitation unit, told Reuters the company expects to reach an agreement for Lot 192 by mid-to-late July.  The reactivation of Lot 192, located near the border with Ecuador, is crucial for supplying Petroperu's newly modernized Talara refinery.

headline: Alphabet Stock Is Having a Bad Year. How AI Can Make or Break the Google Parent.
summary: Google has an edge over OpenAI in one important metric, argues Citizens JMP analyst Andrew Boone.  OpenAI,which created ChatGPT, has 800 million weekly active users compared to some 5 billion for Google.  Boone upgraded Alphabet stock to Outperform from Market Perform and set a $220 price target on the shares.

headline: Sell Short AMZN Put Options (Out-of-the-Money) to Make a 2.0% Monthly Yield
summary: Shorting Amazon.com put options at strike prices below today's trading price (i.e., out-of-the-money) can provide an approximate one-month yield of 2.0%. This allows an investor to set a lower buy-in target price.

headline: Reddit will play an important role in the AI age, says COO
summary: Content publishers such as Reddit (RDDT) are facing challenges as AI advances, with concerns that AI search will drive traffic away from the original sites. Reddit COO Jennifer Wong joins Yahoo Finance Executive Editor Brian Sozzi for an interview at Cannes Lions 2025 to discuss the company's investments in AI and its lawsuit against Anthropic. Reddit alleged the Amazon-backed (AMZN) startup scraped its users' personal data without their consent, then used the data to train its large language model Claude. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out Opening Bid here.

headline: Amazon, Alphabet, Estee Lauder: Upgrades & Downgrades
summary: Market Catalysts Host Brad Smith is joined by ProShares global investment strategist Simeon Hyman to discuss some of the stocks that got upgrades and downgrades. Analysts at BNP Paribas Exane upgraded Amazon (AMZN) shares to OutPerform from Neutral on optimism for the e-commerce giant's next earnings report. The firm's analysts downgraded shares of Alphabet (GOOG, GOOGL) to Neutral from Outperform with analysts seeing short-term risks to the company's earnings. Share of Estée Lauder (EL) were upgraded to Buy from Hold optimism about the company's cost-cutting and turnaround efforts. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts here.

headline: Nvidia vs. Microsoft: Which AI Heavyweight Will Hit $4 Trillion First?
summary: Artificial-intelligence heavyweights  Microsoft  and  Nvidia  continue to battle to be the world’s most valuable company by market capitalization, after surpassing the $3 trillion milestone last year.  Twice this month,  Microsoft  unseated  Nvidia  as the most valuable company, but Nvidia regained its title Wednesday.  Wedbush analysts say we will find out soon enough.

headline: Stablecoins Are the Talk of Wall Street. Here’s When Consumers May Actually Use Them.
summary: For an asset class touted as a boring alternative to volatile cryptocurrencies like  and  stablecoins have generated plenty of attention this June.  The Senate advanced legislation last week to establish a regulatory framework for stablecoins.  Stablecoins—which are a type of cryptocurrency pegged to assets like the U.S. dollar—have a laundry list of use cases, and their market capitalization is primed to almost double from $260 billion today to $500 billion by the end of 2026, according to forecasts from Seaport Research Partners.

headline: Hugging Face Co-Founder Challenges AI Optimists: 'Models Can't Ask Original Scientific Questions'
summary: Thomas Wolf, co-founder and chief science officer at Hugging Face, has cast doubt on the belief that current artificial intelligence systems will lead to major scientific breakthroughs. Wolf told Fortune that today's large language models, or LLMs, excel at providing answers but fall short when it comes to formulating original questions. “In science, asking the question is the hard part,” he said. “Once the question is asked, often the answer is quite obvious, but the tough part is really asking

headline: SoftBank aims to become leading 'artificial super intelligence' platform provider
summary: TOKYO (Reuters) -SoftBank Group CEO Masayoshi Son on Friday said he wants the Japanese technology investment group to become the biggest platform provider for "artificial super intelligence" within the next 10 years.  "We want to become the organiser of the industry in the artificial super intelligence era," Son told shareholders at the group's annual shareholder meeting.  Son likened his aim to the position of dominant technology platform providers such as Microsoft, Amazon and Alphabet's Google, which benefit from a "winner takes all" dynamic.
